Key Match Events: Paul van Meekeren took 4 wickets for 23 runs, winning him the Player of the Match award.
Scott Edwards scored a half-century (50) off 78 balls.
Bangladesh's top score was 35 from Miraz, and four of the top six had single-digit scores.
Pre-Game Insights: Netherlands won by 87 runs in their second win in six games, becoming the first team to win multiple World Cup games.
Bangladesh's collapse and inability to close out the Dutch batting innings led to their disappointment.
The Dutch team bounced back from a huge defeat against Australia to beat Bangladesh in Kolkata.
Post-Match Reflections: Bangladesh fans are disappointed with the team's performance, with many leaving the stadium early.
Netherlands' victory was a significant milestone for them, potentially earning them ICC Full Member status.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dutch team showed resilience and improved performance compared to their previous match against Australia.
The pitch suggested it was a good scoring surface, which could have impacted the game.
